title: Digital Technology-Integrated Learning Design for Professional Competency Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Professional knowledge related to job duties and basic digital tool proficiency
context.additional_context: Custom-designed for social sector professionals. Emphasizes integrating digital technologies into workplace contexts through reflective and holistic learning approaches

learning_goals: Learners select job-appropriate digital tools and design plans to improve workflows using them

Learners analyze three real-world corporate cases applying digital technologies (e.g., AI analytics tools, big data platforms), derive at least two problem-solving strategies using a reflective thinking framework (experience-reflection-improvement), and write a team report meeting at least two of three evaluation checklist criteria (validity, feasibility, innovativeness).
Learners evaluate the impact of digital technology integration on professional development and propose improvement plans through comprehensive learning design
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
